[Primus enim prophetes . . . dei vestri.] This fragment, the text of which is throughout in a very unsatisfactory condition, is in its present position a superfluous anticipation of the argument which follows. The fragment is found only in cod. Fuldensis, and it may have been incorporated from a second edition of the Apology, or may be simply a passage which has survived from the first rough draft of the treatise. Others conjecture it to belong to the Ad Nationes, or some similar tract.
